metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4488 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in libiberty allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted binary, related to "ktypevec."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4488` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdb - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb-multiarch - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb-source - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb64 - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdbserver - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
No subscription required

valgrind - 1:3.11.0-1ubuntu4.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> same commit as CVE-2016-4487 same binutils commit as CVE-2016-2226

criterions.comment: binutils: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
binutils-h8300-hms: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
gcc-arm-none-eabi: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
gcc-h8300-hms: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
gccxml: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
gdb package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5').
ht: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
nescc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
sdcc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
valgrind package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.11.0-1ubuntu4.2').
